title: Instructional Design for Enhancing Online Mathematics Class Effectiveness and Digital Well-Being

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Pre-/in-service teachers must develop strategies for online mathematics instruction that simultaneously consider learning effectiveness and digital well-being. Self-directed learning environments provided through LMS

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to apply the three elements of Self-Determination Theory (autonomy, competence, relatedness) to online mathematics instruction
Learners can analyze the impact of social and technical support strategies on online learning satisfaction and digital well-being using a structural equation model.
Learners can develop mathematics lesson designs incorporating digital well-being elements through project-based assessment.

resources: LMS platform (bulletin board, quiz, assignment submission features)
Learning support tools (video conferencing system, collaboration tools)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
